name: Bilateral Trigeminal-Tentorial Meningioma Syndrome
chief_complaint: Worsening facial numbness and headaches that feel like electric shocks
physical_findings: Decreased corneal reflex on affected side
prognosis: Guarded - 60% 5-year progression-free survival with current treatments
description: Rare meningioma variant involving both trigeminal nerve sheaths and tentorium cerebelli, causing combined cranial nerve V and VIII compression. Characteristic 'kissing lesions' appearance on contrast-enhanced MRI with dural tail signs. Often misdiagnosed as atypical trigeminal neuralgia initially.
